channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Live Briefing: Israel condemns Amsterdam attack; U.N. decries ‘unprecedented level of killing’ in Gaza
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Adela Suliman
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu condemned an attack on Israeli soccer fans in Amsterdam, calling it a “horrific anti-Semitic incident.”

item.title: Israeli fans attacked after soccer match in Amsterdam
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Jintak Han, Alom Rom
item.description: Dutch and Israeli officials condemned the attacks, which came amid a rise in antisemitic incidents in Europe since the beginning of the war in Gaza.

item.title: With Trump’s win, Australia worries AUKUS may come under new scrutiny
item.dc:creator: Michael E. Miller
item.description: Australia has already spent billions on the nuclear-powered submarine deal agreed with the Biden administration, and fears President-elect Trump might disrupt that.

item.title: Israeli fans attacked after soccer match in Amsterdam
item.dc:creator: Jintak Han

item.title: In Trump victory, Netanyahu sees himself as ‘the great winner’
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Miriam Berger, Claire Parker

item.title: Israel Katz, new Israeli defense minister, is longtime Netanyahu ally
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris

item.title: As fear of Middle East war grows, more Jewish Americans move to Israel
item.dc:creator: Rachel Chason
item.description: Since the Hamas attack of Oct. 7, 2023, over 11,700 Americans have opened applications to immigrate to Israel. That’s nearly double the number the year before.

item.title: Trump’s victory cements the triumph of the illiberal West
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Trump’s win was hailed by far-right populists around the world, who were gleeful about the seeming exhaustion of the liberal status quo.

item.title: ‘Queer’ movie ban in Turkey prompts film festival cancellation
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Baker
item.description: The festival’s host said the ban on “Queer,” which stars Daniel Craig, “restricts art and freedom of expression.”

item.title: Hurricane Rafael plunges Cuba into another nationwide blackout
item.dc:creator: Ruby Mellen, Samantha Schmidt
item.description: The storm has damaged the country’s already struggling electrical infrastructure, leading to widespread power outages.

item.title: 50 world leaders meet to strategize on how to deal with Trump
item.dc:creator: Ellen Francis
item.description: In Budapest, leaders spoke about the need for unity and autonomy. But there was also agitation about Trump’s return and Germany’s political paralysis.

item.title: ‘We have won’: Russians envision new global system with Trump victory
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Catherine Belton
item.description: Russians see Donald Trump’s win as a victory for conservative, isolationist forces in the world against a liberal, Western-dominated global order.

item.title: ‘This is awkward’: World leaders contend with past insults of Trump
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: After Donald Trump’s 2024 election win, officials in Britain, France and Australia who previously criticized him are deleting tweets and writing congratulatory messages.

item.title: Viral breakdancer Raygun to stop competing after Olympics backlash
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: Australian B-girl Rachael Gunn said it would be “difficult” to compete now with the “level of scrutiny that’s going to be there,” although she still loved dancing.

item.title: China, already grappling with a weak economy, braces for Trump’s return
item.dc:creator: Katrina Northrop
item.description: Ties between Beijing and Washington worsened sharply during Donald Trump’s first term. But some in China see a potential bridge builder in his second: Elon Musk.

item.title: Trump win spurs interest in 4B, fringe South Korean movement to swear off men
item.dc:creator: Kelly Kasulis Cho, Kelsey Ables
item.description: In light of Donald Trump’s victory, some American women say they are turning to a movement that advocates no sex, dating or marriage with men and no children.

item.title: Ukrainian congratulations do little to mask fears about Trump presidency
item.dc:creator: David Stern, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: Trump has expressed misgivings about continuing to support Ukraine in its war with Russia. Ukrainian officials recognize they need to win him over.

item.title: Trump win complicates Biden’s lame-duck foreign policy
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung, Michael Birnbaum, Missy Ryan
item.description: From Ukraine to Gaza, Trump’s unilateral and unpredictable tendencies could embolden both allies and enemies.

item.title: Trump win leaves Russia jubilant and Europe putting on a brave face
item.dc:creator: Washington Post staff
item.description: Israel’s and Ukraine’s leaders were among the first to congratulate Donald Trump. His victory is resonating across the globe.

item.title: U.S. vote was peaceful, but Trump’s fraud claims hurt trust, international observers say
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Baker
item.description: International monitors saw “a well-run process” in Tuesday’s U.S. election, but warned of “intolerant language against women and immigrants by one candidate.”

item.title: Trump’s win puts militarized, mass deportations on the agenda
item.dc:creator: Nick Miroff, Maria Sacchetti
item.description: The reelection of Donald Trump sets the stage for policy changes that could upend the lives of millions of immigrants and recast the U.S. economy and labor force.

item.title: German governing coalition collapses, adding upheaval in uncertain moment
item.dc:creator: Kate Brady
item.description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz fired his finance minister and announced a confidence vote that is widely expected to fail and pave the way to early elections in the spring.

item.title: In Trump victory, Netanyahu sees himself as ‘the great winner’
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Miriam Berger, Claire Parker
item.description: Across Israel, a country battered by its longest-ever war and roiled by internal crises, many breathed a sigh of relief after Trump’s sweeping triumph.

item.title: The U.S. has never been led by a woman. See how many countries have been.
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall, Dylan Moriarty
item.description: The U.S. has still not been led by a woman — a state increasingly rare in the world. Enter your birthday to find out the number of women who have served as president or prime minister around the world.

item.title: Right-wing populists cheer the return of Trump, one of their own
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faiola, Kate Brady
item.description: Populist leaders around the world said Donald Trump’s election victory was an endorsement of their stance on immigration, on climate and in the culture wars.

item.title: Israel Katz, new Israeli defense minister, is longtime Netanyahu ally
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris
item.description: Analysts describe Katz as a yes-man who will give Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu more freedom on the battlefield and help ensure his own political survival.

item.title: Ukraine says forces clash with North Korean troops for first time
item.dc:creator: David Stern, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky implored his Western allies to take action over Russia’s use of North Korean troops in the war.
